intro: Physaria argyraea subsp. argyraea, commonly known as silverleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Physaria argyraea subsp. argyraea is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
